column1: The Sabak Bernam District is a district and a parliamentary constituency in north-western Selangor
column2: Malaysia. It covers an area of 997 square kilometres
column4: 153 at the 2010 Census (excluding foreigns). It is situated at the northwestern corner of Selangor. It is bordered by the state of Perak to the north
column5: the district of Hulu Selangor to the east
column6: the district of Kuala Selangor to the south
column7: and the Straits of Malacca to the west. Bernam River forms its border with Perak. Towns in Sabak Bernam include Sabak

column1: The district is mainly a rice growing area. As such
column2: Sabak Bernam's main economic activity is agriculture. Sabak Bernam is the westernmost district of Selangor; at 100 km from Kuala Lumpur
column3: Sabak Bernam is the furthest district in Selangor from both Kuala Lumpur and state capital Shah Alam.

column1: Sabak Bernam District is divided into 5 mukims
